Package lcm.java.swing

Class CustomFont

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Font
lcm.java.swing.CustomFont
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CustomFont extends Font
Class to handle fonts in Swing. It extends java.awt.Font (so it can be used transparently). It has many public pre-defined options for fonts, and facilitates creating new ones. It has methods to change fonts on Swing components, while dealing with other possible internal components inside them.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • ARIAL_20

      public static final CustomFont ARIAL_20
      Plain Arial 20. Default font for 1040p or lesser resolutions.

    • ARIAL_40

      public static final CustomFont ARIAL_40
      Plain Arial 40. Default font for resolutions greater than 1040p.

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomFont

      public CustomFont(String name, CustomFont.Style style, int size)
      Constructor receiving all possible parameters for a CustomFont.
      Parameters:
      name - - Name of the Font (according to java.awt.Font).
      style - - The desired style for the font.
      size - - The desired size for the font.

    • CustomFont

      public CustomFont(String name, int size)
      Overload of the complete constructor, considering PLAIN as default style.
      Parameters:
      name - - Name of the Font (according to java.awt.Font).
      size - - The desired size for the font.
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public void apply(boolean force, Component... components)
      Applies a font to all the given components. If any of the components is a container, the font will also be applied to its inner components, except inner components that already have a font applied (this can be changed setting the first parameter force = true).
      Parameters:
      force - - Wether to apply the font on inner components of containers even if they already had a font applied.
      components - - Components to have the font applied on them.

    • apply

      public void apply(Component... components)
      Overload of apply(boolean, Component...) having force = false by default.
      Parameters:
      components - - Components to have the font applied on them.
      See Also:
      • apply(boolean, Component...)
